Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies have demoted Ranger Suarez to being the fourth starter in the upcoming NLDS.
Ranger Suarez has been struggling in his second half of the season, with a 5.74 ERA in seven starts.
The Phillies are considering whether to start Aaron Nola or Cristopher Sanchez in Game 2 of the NLDS.
Others: Ranger Suarez was once a leading candidate for the N.L. Cy Young Award but has struggled in his second half of the season.
The Phillies have a short leash for Suarez in the postseason.
The Phillies' starting rotation depth allows for one of the team's top pitchers to not play to the best of their ability while still having success.
